title: Business & Finance
text:
Wages and prices continued to rise rapidly in the late summer, keeping the Fed on track for more interest-rate increases as it attempts to cool economic growth and bring down high inflation.

---

Credit-card debt has returned to where it was before the pandemic, with U.S. balances hitting $916 billion in September, nearly identical to December 2019 levels.

---

U.S. stocks rose sharply, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow advancing 2.5%, 2.9% and 2.6%, respectively.

---

Oil giant Exxon reported its most lucrative quarter ever, while rival Chevron posted profit near the record it hit in the prior quarter.

---

Germany's economy, Europe's largest, grew modestly in the three months through September, but economists expect a bleak period ahead.

---

VW posted a 29% drop in net profit as auto makers face cost headwinds and ongoing supply-chain disruptions.
